The '''Chetwood''' was the woodlands that lay east and south of the town of [[Bree]],<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Chetwood'', p. 16</ref> some forty miles east of [[the Shire]]<ref name="Hobbits">{{FR|Hobbits}}, p. 4</ref>. The village of [[Archet]] was built on its edge.<ref>{{FR|Sign}}, p. 149</ref>

Prior to the settlement of the Shire many Hobbits lived in Bree and in the Chetwood nearby.<ref name="Hobbits" />  When [[Aragorn|Strider]] led the four hobbits out of Bree they spent three days in the Chetwood before descending to the [[Midgewater Marshes]].<ref>{{FR|Knife}}, pp. 182-5</ref>

==Etymology==
'''Chetwood''' is modelled on a relic of British nomenclature.<ref>{{App|Translation}}, p. 135</ref>  The first element ''chet'' (also found in ''[[Archet#Etymology|Archet]]'') is of [[Celtic]] origin and means "wood". The second element is the english word ''wood'' with the same meaning as the first element.<ref name="Nomen">{{HM|N}}, entry '''Chetwood'', p. 767 and 'entry '''''<nowiki/>''Archet'<nowiki/>'', p. 765</ref> The first element is seen in the [[Welsh]] word ''[[Wiktionary:coed#Welsh|coed]]'' for "wood".<ref name="etym">{{webcite|author=[[David Salo]]|articleurl=https://tolkienlistsearch.herokuapp.com/message/5e9c35b63ee6a6c41e9862d6|articlename=Hobbitish Place-names (1.21)|dated=23 November 1998|website=[[Elfling]]|accessed=2022-09-23}}</ref>

==Inspiration==
[[Tom Shippey]] mentions [[Wikipedia:Chetwode|Chetwode]],<ref>[[Tom Shippey]], [[The Road to Middle-earth]], Chapter 4 A Cartographic Plot, Getting started, p. 124</ref> a village in Buckinghamshire close to the border of Oxfordshire, whose existence was first recorded in the year 949 as ''Cetwuda''. 

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Chetwood.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Chetwood in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Chetwood consisted of three areas in the region of [[Bree-land]]. Chetwood South was located around the [[East Road]] south of [[Staddle]], south-east of [[Bree]] and south-west of the [[Midgewater Marshes]]. Chetwood North was north of the marsh, between [[Combe]] and the [[Weather Hills]]. The Far Chetwood lay in the northeast of Bree-land beyond the [[Archet]] Dale, south of the lake of Nen Harn on the border with the [[North Downs]]. Early in the [[War of the Ring]], bandits of the Blackwold gang lived in the woods.
